content: a short hat round 9 for a 21 sts/28 row = 4 in stockinette st using larger medium-length hat or round 1 for a long hat all needles after blocking 24 sts/28 row = 4 in body chart pattern using hat lengths end with round 29 larger needles after blocking chart of written instructions will be worked 8 times in each round abbreviations crown k knit work rounds 1-24 of crown chart or written k2tog knit two together instructions 8 sts remain p purl break yarn and draw through remaining sts pull p2tog purl two together tight then draw yarn through sts again to secure p2tog tbl purl two together through finishing the back loop weave in ends and block the body of this hat p3tog purl three together grows and achieves its shape through wet block- c4f cable 4 to the front - slip 2 sts to ing dinner plates were used for the medium- cable needle hold to front knit 2 length and long hats shown the short hat was from holding needle knit 2 from blocked using an infalted balloon both methods cable needle work well c6f cable 6 to the front - slip 3 sts to to prevent stretching the ribbed hat band waste cable needle hold to front knit 3 yarn was basted in a running stitch along the from holding needle knit 3 from round between the ribbed band and the hat cable needle body after the hat was soaked and placed over c6b cable 6 to the back -
